etymology.description: Phonetic: 化(化) (huà, "transform") + Semantic: 十(十) ("stalk and leaves") -> 華(華) ("magnificent") -> Simplified to 华 with 化(化)
etymology.interpretation: The traditional character 華(華) uses 十(十) to evoke a stalk with leaves, representing growth and magnificence. In the simplified form 华, 化(化) helps retain the original sound while removing visual complexity.
etymology.simplification: The character was simplified by using 化(化) to streamline its phonetic component and reduce stroke count, while 十(十) was omitted.

examples.chinese: 中国古代文明辉煌(中國古代文明輝煌)，成就了华夏的美名(成就了華夏的美名)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó gǔdài wénmíng huīhuáng, chéngjiùle huáxià de měimíng.
examples.english: The brilliance of ancient Chinese civilization has earned China a magnificent reputation.

examples.chinese: 他穿着一件华服(他穿著一件華服)，显得格外自信(顯得格外自信)。
examples.pinyin: Tā chuānzhuó yī jiàn huáfú, xiǎnde géwài zìxìn.
examples.english: He wears a magnificent garment, looking exceptionally confident.
